title: I see kat bans so often...
body: Why ban her, its so easy to just CC lock her once she starts spinning, same with akali, play lee (if she is top) or karma (if she is mid) so you can always see her. also why do people hate annie so much, she is an easy kill if you know how to not get stunned. is this in all elos or just bronze?

replies.body: Because you can avoid a point and click stun, OP your bronze is showing.

Yes these champions have counterplay, that doesn't mean everyone is confident in their ability to execute that counter-play, particularly when you may have co-ordinate counter moves (e.g. cc's) with your team.

because she's a no skill cheese champ. you can either wait for her to ult and not use your cc, whilst the enemy beats on you, or use your cc on the enemy team so kat can get a full ult off.
people hate annie because she can hold her stun for however long she wants, forcing you out of lane because of the risk of her flash-ulting for an easy kill.

its not only that, kat does TONS of damage even without a full ult...

kat is just TOO easy for the reward she gives. but sadly, there isnt much to tune down now since the fix to how her reset works.

kat bans are understandable, annie bans less so since she has seen quite a bit less play lately. either way, both are low risk to their reward, and low skill to be able to do what they do.
still not sure how well the new AP item fits on either of them tho...but the 120 AP is really nice, same with the MS.
i understand all your points here, quite good points, but im sick of seeing kat banned why not ban darius or teemo with those retarded passives especially in bornze where no one knows what a heal is

If the enemy team picks Kat then picking a few champs with point and click cc is definitely the best way of dealing with it in my opinion. Champions like Vi, Warwick, Lissandra, etc. If you only have one champ with an ability guaranteed to interrupt her ult then the enemy team is going to catch on to it very quickly and just obliterate that champ at the start of every teamfight.  If you go against a Kat with the right comp you can easily render her useless.
(The best example I can think of this was about 6 months ago playing Panth mid with J4 Jungle, Vayne Ad, Chode top and Janna support, the Kat was rendered to just cannon fodder, as the second she tried to ult she'd just get cc'd to death) obviously that sort of coordination is very difficult in solo q, and people just seem to tunnel on their own champion pick rather than trying to pick champions that either counter champions on the enemy team or give you more tools to deal with them, if you've already got Yi jungle and Fedora top then picking a champ with no teamfight potential or lockdown isn't going to help you when there's a fed Talon decimating your team, even Malzahar is excellent for dealing with snowballing enemy champs. But I think you should always go into games expecting to go against a champ with either ridiculous mobility or massive snowball potential, so you should try and always ensure your team comp has some form of hard cc for dealing with champions like that and if all else fails take that responsibility yourself. 10/0 Katarina is a lot easier to kill whilst she's getting ulted by Warwick :)
Just thoes champs that are powerful even if they loose lane
